intro: Antherotoma afzelii, commonly known as the African sandalwood, is a small, evergreen shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Burseraceae and is characterized by its aromatic, fragrant leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces small, woody fruits that contain smooth, black seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its medicinal and aromatic properties, it has been traditionally used in local remedies and perfumery.
